repnme.cdata!:
East Timor - Dili Community Employment
            Generation Project

abstracts.cdata!:
The overall project outcome rating is
            satisfactory. The outcome of employment generation was
            highly satisfactory and in fact far surpassed targets.
            Considering extremely limited institutional capacity, and
            economic and civil instability at the time the project was
            implemented, project achievements are noteworthy. Project
            sustainability is rated as likely, and is related to the
            government's implementing agency's improved
            ability to remount a similar safety-net operation in the
            future (if needed); and the beneficial institutional impact
            of the project on the development of social capital and
            government-community linkages. Both World Bank and Borrower
            performances are assessed as satisfactory overall. Some
            lessons learned are: Community management structures are a
            successful implementation arrangement for rapid employment
            generation and an important mechanism to strengthen bonds of
            social capital. Rubble collection and waste management, as
            employment activities, could be expanded to include urban
            beautification initiatives. Spot checks and other
            supervisory mechanisms, and transparency in and
            communicatrion of recruitment procedures and wages are
            critical to controlling corruption risks. Transition to
            regular operations requires more atention to developing an
            longer-term waste management plan. Follow-on vocational
            education training and employment generation for youth would
            have been advisable, since youth unemployment is an
            important cause of future civil unrest and crime.

5086837.trustfund:
TF023623-TFET - EAST TIMOR DILI
            COMMUNITY EMPLOYMENT GENERATION PROJECT,TF023762-TFET - IBRD OPERATING COSTS

5086837.majtheme: Social protection and risk management,Social dev/gender/inclusion

repnme.cdata!:
East Timor - Dili Community Employment
            Generation Project

abstracts.cdata!:
The Dili community Employment Generation
            Project aims to generate short term employment; raise urban
            incomes; and build social capital through community-managed
            environmental clean-up. The project has one component, for
            labor intensive activities of debris collection and solid
            waste management. With a duration of five months, the
            project will be divided into three stages: 1) A pilot stage
            involving one community in the most urgent area of Dili to
            establish recruitment and related procedures and their
            effectiveness. This phase will concentrate on the cleaning
            up of rubble and debris before moving onto refuse removal.
            2) A second stage involving cleaning of rubble and debris
            from within some 25 functional villages within Dili. 3) When
            building-rubble and debris is substantially cleared from
            within a community attention will focus on the collection
            and removal of domestic refuse. Benefits from the project
            will derive from: a) social stabilization established by the
            provision of short term employment; b) injection of funds
            caused by wage payments into local communities; c) public
            health improvements created by environmental enhancement; d)
            community confidence in reconstruction efforts created by
            visual impact of cleaning the city; and e) social
            reintegration within and between communities initiated by
            community cooperation.
